description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4k751","text":"This protocol outlines the procedures for conducting heat treatment for clearing Batrachochytrium dendrobatidis (Bd) infection of H. boettgeri. It ensures that individuals are free of Bd for use in subsequent experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Chytrid Fungi - Molecular and Genomic Techniques

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bn9v0","text":"Conclusion:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85cvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtbuo","text":"This protocol outlines the steps for quarantining and conducting heat treatment on H. boettgeri frogs infected with Bd to eliminate the infection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"16smb","text":"H. boettgeri adult frogs that are Bd-positive","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjfuq","text":"38 L glass tanks (25 × 30 × 50 cm) with plastic lids containing holes smaller than 1 cm in diameter for air circulation","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ads3","text":"Aquarium heater (EHEIM thermocontrol 75 W, Deizisau, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2317n","text":"Aquarium filter (Tetra, Blacksburg, VA, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcp1t","text":"EcoTestr CTS1 meter (Oakton, Vernon Hills, IL, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69jar","text":"Water testing kit (API Liquid Test Kits, API®, Chalfont, PA, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gg66","text":"Gravel substrate (diameter \u003e 1 cm to prevent ingestion by the animals)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt13c","text":"Artificial plants","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4hf3","text":"PVC pipes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fm4v","text":"Reverse osmosis (RO) water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1l4d","text":"Synthetic sea salt mixture (Instant Ocean® Sea Salt, Blacksburg, VA, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dla0d","text":"Sodium bicarbonate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ce85d","text":"Brine shrimp (Artemia sp., BIO-MARINE®, Hawthorne, CA, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hl1q","text":"Frozen gamma-irradiated bloodworms (Chironomus sp., Tropical Marine Center, UK)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7omkt","text":"Powdered fry food (Sera® Micron Nature, Heinsberg, Germany)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1at9i","text":"Small-granule fish food (BUG BITESTM Tropical Formula, Mansfield, MA, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":34,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bihi","text":"Nitrifying bacterial suspension (ProLine® Aquaculture Bacteria Concentrate, Apopka, FL, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"khso","text":"VirkonTM Aquatic (LANXESS, Pittsburgh, PA, USA)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":6,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnso0","text":"Place Bd-positive frogs in 38 L standard system glass tanks, condition the water, feed the animals, and conduct water changes as described in “Housing and Care for Hymenochirus boettgeri” protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gelp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7h1k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"jt11","text":"Ensure that Bd-positive frogs are completely isolated from Bd-negative frogs to prevent further transmission.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cbrfk","text":"Gradually increase the water temperature in the quarantine standard system tanks from room temperature to   over a period of 10 days using an aquarium heater.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3o1c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86hhu","text":"Gradually decrease the water temperature from   to   over a period of five days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":51,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"161dv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8dnvj","text":"Monitor and maintain consistent temperature levels throughout the treatment process.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"259mv","text":"Monitor the animals for an additional 10 days after the heat treatment, and then transfer them to permanent aquaria.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Quarantine and heat treatment for Hymenochirus boettgeri infected with Bd
